db:abstract.db:para: The QColor class provides colors based on RGB, HSV or CMYK values.

db:listitem.db:para: QColor is part of Painting Classesappearance

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A color is normally specified in terms of RGB (red, green, and blue) components, but it is also possible to specify it in terms of HSV (hue, saturation, and value) and CMYK (cyan, magenta, yellow and black) components. In addition a color can be specified using a color name. The color name can be any of the SVG 1.0 color names.

The QColor constructor creates the color based on RGB values. To create a QColor based on either HSV or CMYK values, use the toHsv() and toCmyk() functions respectively. These functions return a copy of the color using the desired format. In addition the static fromRgb(), fromHsv() and fromCmyk() functions create colors from the specified values. Alternatively, a color can be converted to any of the three formats using the convertTo() function (returning a copy of the color in the desired format), or any of the setRgb(), setHsv() and setCmyk() functions altering this color's format. The spec() function tells how the color was specified.

A color can be set by passing an RGB string (such as "#112233"), or an ARGB string (such as "#ff112233") or a color name (such as "blue"), to the fromString() function. The color names are taken from the SVG 1.0 color names. The name() function returns the name of the color in the format "#RRGGBB". Colors can also be set using setRgb(), setHsv() and setCmyk(). To get a lighter or darker color use the lighter() and darker() functions respectively.

The isValid() function indicates whether a QColor is legal at all. For example, a RGB color with RGB values out of range is illegal. For performance reasons, QColor mostly disregards illegal colors, and for that reason, the result of using an invalid color is undefined.

The color components can be retrieved individually, e.g with red(), hue() and cyan(). The values of the color components can also be retrieved in one go using the getRgb(), getHsv() and getCmyk() functions. Using the RGB color model, the color components can in addition be accessed with rgb().

There are several related non-members: QRgb is a typdef for an unsigned int representing the RGB value triplet (r, g, b). Note that it also can hold a value for the alpha-channel (for more information, see the Alpha-Blended Drawing section). The qRed(), qBlue() and qGreen() functions return the respective component of the given QRgb value, while the qRgb() and qRgba() functions create and return the QRgb triplet based on the given component values. Finally, the qAlpha() function returns the alpha component of the provided QRgb, and the qGray() function calculates and return a gray value based on the given value.
QColor is platform and device independent. The QColormap class maps the color to the hardware.
For more information about painting in general, see the Paint System documentation.

db:section.db:title: Integer vs. Floating Point Precision
db:section.db:para: QColor supports floating point precision and provides floating point versions of all the color components functions, e.g. getRgbF(), hueF() and fromCmykF(). Note that since the components are stored using 16-bit integers, there might be minor deviations between the values set using, for example, setRgbF() and the values returned by the getRgbF() function due to rounding.
While the integer based functions take values in the range 0-255 (except hue() which must have values within the range 0-359), the floating point functions accept values in the range 0.0 - 1.0.

db:section.db:title: Alpha-Blended Drawing
db:section.db:para: QColor also support alpha-blended outlining and filling. The alpha channel of a color specifies the transparency effect, 0 represents a fully transparent color, while 255 represents a fully opaque color. For example:
The code above produces the following output:

The alpha channel of a color can be retrieved and set using the alpha() and setAlpha() functions if its value is an integer, and alphaF() and setAlphaF() if its value is float. By default, the alpha-channel is set to 255 (opaque). To retrieve and set all the RGB color components (including the alpha-channel) in one go, use the rgba() and setRgba() functions.

db:section.db:title: Predefined Colors
db:section.db:para: There are 20 predefined QColor objects in the QColorConstants namespace, including black, white, primary and secondary colors, darker versions of these colors, and three shades of gray. Furthermore, the QColorConstants::Svg namespace defines QColor objects for the standard SVG color keyword names.
The QColorConstants::Color0, QColorConstants::Color1 and QColorConstants::Transparent colors are used for special purposes.

QColorConstants::Color0 (zero pixel value) and QColorConstants::Color1 (non-zero pixel value) are special colors for drawing in QBitmaps. Painting with QColorConstants::Color0 sets the bitmap bits to 0 (transparent; i.e., background), and painting with c{QColorConstants::Color1} sets the bits to 1 (opaque; i.e., foreground).
QColorConstants::Transparent is used to indicate a transparent pixel. When painting with this value, a pixel value will be used that is appropriate for the underlying pixel format in use.
For historical reasons, the 20 predefined colors are also available in the Qt::GlobalColor enumeration.
Finally, QColor recognizes a variety of color names (as strings); the static colorNames() function returns a QStringList color names that QColor knows about.

db:section.db:title: The Extended RGB Color Model
db:section.db:para: The extended RGB color model, also known as the scRGB color space, is the same the RGB color model except it allows values under 0.0, and over 1.0. This makes it possible to represent colors that would otherwise be outside the range of the RGB colorspace but still use the same values for colors inside the RGB colorspace.

db:section.db:title: The HSV Color Model
db:section.db:para: The RGB model is hardware-oriented. Its representation is close to what most monitors show. In contrast, HSV represents color in a way more suited to the human perception of color. For example, the relationships "stronger than", "darker than", and "the opposite of" are easily expressed in HSV but are much harder to express in RGB.
HSV, like RGB, has three components:

db:listitem.db:para: H, for hue, is in the range 0 to 359 if the color is chromatic (not gray), or meaningless if it is gray. It represents degrees on the color wheel familiar to most people. Red is 0 (degrees), green is 120, and blue is 240.
S, for saturation, is in the range 0 to 255, and the bigger it is, the stronger the color is. Grayish colors have saturation near 0; very strong colors have saturation near 255.
V, for value, is in the range 0 to 255 and represents lightness or brightness of the color. 0 is black; 255 is as far from black as possible.

db:section.db:para: Here are some examples: pure red is H=0, S=255, V=255; a dark red, moving slightly towards the magenta, could be H=350 (equivalent to -10), S=255, V=180; a grayish light red could have H about 0 (say 350-359 or 0-10), S about 50-100, and S=255.
Qt returns a hue value of -1 for achromatic colors. If you pass a hue value that is too large, Qt forces it into range. Hue 360 or 720 is treated as 0; hue 540 is treated as 180.
In addition to the standard HSV model, Qt provides an alpha-channel to feature alpha-blended drawing.

db:section.db:title: The HSL Color Model
db:section.db:para: HSL is similar to HSV, however instead of the Value parameter, HSL specifies a Lightness parameter which maps somewhat differently to the brightness of the color.

Similarly, the HSL saturation value is not in general the same as the HSV saturation value for the same color. hslSaturation() provides the color's HSL saturation value, while saturation() and hsvSaturation() provides the HSV saturation value.
The hue value is defined to be the same in HSL and HSV.

db:section.db:title: The CMYK Color Model
db:section.db:para: While the RGB and HSV color models are used for display on computer monitors, the CMYK model is used in the four-color printing process of printing presses and some hard-copy devices.

CMYK has four components, all in the range 0-255: cyan (C), magenta (M), yellow (Y) and black (K). Cyan, magenta and yellow are called subtractive colors; the CMYK color model creates color by starting with a white surface and then subtracting color by applying the appropriate components. While combining cyan, magenta and yellow gives the color black, subtracting one or more will yield any other color. When combined in various percentages, these three colors can create the entire spectrum of colors.

Mixing 100 percent of cyan, magenta and yellow does produce black, but the result is unsatisfactory since it wastes ink, increases drying time, and gives a muddy colour when printing. For that reason, black is added in professional printing to provide a solid black tone; hence the term 'four color process'.
In addition to the standard CMYK model, Qt provides an alpha-channel to feature alpha-blended drawing.

db:section.db:title: enum QColor::NameFormat
db:section.db:para: How to format the output of the name() function

db:td.db:para: #RRGGBB A "#" character followed by three two-digit hexadecimal numbers (i.e. #RRGGBB).
#AARRGGBB A "#" character followed by four two-digit hexadecimal numbers (i.e. #AARRGGBB).

db:section.db:title: enum QColor::Spec
db:section.db:para: The type of color specified, either RGB, extended RGB, HSV, CMYK or HSL.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QColor::QColor()
db:section.db:para: Constructs an invalid color with the RGB value (0, 0, 0). An invalid color is a color that is not properly set up for the underlying window system.
The alpha value of an invalid color is unspecified.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QColor::QColor(QRgb color)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a color with the value color. The alpha component is ignored and set to solid.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QColor::QColor(QRgba64 rgba64)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a color with the value rgba64.

db:section.db:title: QColor::QColor(const QString &name)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a named color in the same way as setNamedColor() using the given name.
The color is left invalid if the name cannot be parsed.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QColor::QColor(int r, int g, int b, int a = 255)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a color with the RGB value r, g, b, and the alpha-channel (transparency) value of a.
The color is left invalid if any of the arguments are invalid.

db:section.db:title: QColor::QColor(QLatin1StringView name)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a named color in the same way as setNamedColor() using the given name.
This is an overloaded function.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QColor::QColor(Qt::GlobalColor color)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Constructs a new color with a color value of color.

db:section.db:title: QColor::QColor(const char *name)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a named color in the same way as setNamedColor() using the given name.
This is an overloaded function.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QColor::alpha() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the alpha color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] float QColor::alphaF() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the alpha color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QColor::black() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the black color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] float QColor::blackF() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the black color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QColor::blue() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the blue color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] float QColor::blueF() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the blue color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [static] QStringList QColor::colorNames()
db:section.db:para: Returns a QStringList containing the color names Qt knows about.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QColor QColor::convertTo(QColor::Spec colorSpec) const
db:section.db:para: Creates a copy of this color in the format specified by colorSpec.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QColor::cyan() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the cyan color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] float QColor::cyanF() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the cyan color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QColor QColor::darker(int factor = 200) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a darker (or lighter) color, but does not change this object.

If the factor is greater than 100, this functions returns a darker color. Setting factor to 300 returns a color that has one-third the brightness. If the factor is less than 100, the return color is lighter, but we recommend using the lighter() function for this purpose. If the factor is 0 or negative, the return value is unspecified.
The function converts the current color to HSV, divides the value (V) component by factor and converts the color back to it's original color spec.

db:section.db:title: [static] QColor QColor::fromCmyk(int c, int m, int y, int k, int a = 255)
db:section.db:para: Static convenience function that returns a QColor constructed from the given CMYK color values: c (cyan), m (magenta), y (yellow), k (black), and a (alpha-channel, i.e. transparency).
All the values must be in the range 0-255.

db:section.db:title: [static] QColor QColor::fromCmykF(float c, float m, float y, float k, float a = 1.0)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Static convenience function that returns a QColor constructed from the given CMYK color values: c (cyan), m (magenta), y (yellow), k (black), and a (alpha-channel, i.e. transparency).
All the values must be in the range 0.0-1.0.

db:section.db:title: [static] QColor QColor::fromHsl(int h, int s, int l, int a = 255)
db:section.db:para: Static convenience function that returns a QColor constructed from the HSV color values, h (hue), s (saturation), l (lightness), and a (alpha-channel, i.e. transparency).
The value of s, l, and a must all be in the range 0-255; the value of h must be in the range 0-359.

db:section.db:title: [static] QColor QColor::fromHslF(float h, float s, float l, float a = 1.0)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Static convenience function that returns a QColor constructed from the HSV color values, h (hue), s (saturation), l (lightness), and a (alpha-channel, i.e. transparency).
All the values must be in the range 0.0-1.0.

db:section.db:title: [static] QColor QColor::fromHsv(int h, int s, int v, int a = 255)
db:section.db:para: Static convenience function that returns a QColor constructed from the HSV color values, h (hue), s (saturation), v (value), and a (alpha-channel, i.e. transparency).
The value of s, v, and a must all be in the range 0-255; the value of h must be in the range 0-359.

db:section.db:title: [static] QColor QColor::fromHsvF(float h, float s, float v, float a = 1.0)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Static convenience function that returns a QColor constructed from the HSV color values, h (hue), s (saturation), v (value), and a (alpha-channel, i.e. transparency).
All the values must be in the range 0.0-1.0.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] QColor QColor::fromRgb(QRgb rgb)
db:section.db:para: Static convenience function that returns a QColor constructed from the given QRgb value rgb.
The alpha component of rgb is ignored (i.e. it is automatically set to 255), use the fromRgba() function to include the alpha-channel specified by the given QRgb value.

db:section.db:title: [static] QColor QColor::fromRgb(int r, int g, int b, int a = 255)
db:section.db:para: Static convenience function that returns a QColor constructed from the RGB color values, r (red), g (green), b (blue), and a (alpha-channel, i.e. transparency).
All the values must be in the range 0-255.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] QColor QColor::fromRgba64(QRgba64 rgba64)
db:section.db:para: Static convenience function that returns a QColor constructed from the given QRgba64 value rgba64.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] QColor QColor::fromRgba64(ushort r, ushort g, ushort b, ushort a = USHRT_MAX)
db:section.db:para: Static convenience function that returns a QColor constructed from the RGBA64 color values, r (red), g (green), b (blue), and a (alpha-channel, i.e. transparency).

db:section.db:title: [static] QColor QColor::fromRgbF(float r, float g, float b, float a = 1.0)
db:section.db:para: Static convenience function that returns a QColor constructed from the RGB color values, r (red), g (green), b (blue), and a (alpha-channel, i.e. transparency).
The alpha value must be in the range 0.0-1.0. If any of the other values are outside the range of 0.0-1.0 the color model will be set as ExtendedRgb.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] QColor QColor::fromRgba(QRgb rgba)
db:section.db:para: Static convenience function that returns a QColor constructed from the given QRgb value rgba.
Unlike the fromRgb() function, the alpha-channel specified by the given QRgb value is included.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 6.4] QColor QColor::fromString(QAnyStringView name)
db:section.db:para: Returns an RGB QColor parsed from name, which may be in one of these formats:

db:listitem.db:para: #RGB (each of R, G, and B is a single hex digit)

A name from the list of colors defined in the list of SVG color keyword names provided by the World Wide Web Consortium; for example, "steelblue" or "gainsboro". These color names work on all platforms. Note that these color names are not the same as defined by the Qt::GlobalColor enums, e.g. "green" and Qt::green does not refer to the same color.
transparent - representing the absence of a color.

db:section.db:para: Returns an invalid color if name cannot be parsed.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.4.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::getCmyk(int *c, int *m, int *y, int *k, int *a = nullptr) const
db:section.db:para: Sets the contents pointed to by c, m, y, k, and a, to the cyan, magenta, yellow, black, and alpha-channel (transparency) components of the color's CMYK value.
These components can be retrieved individually using the cyan(), magenta(), yellow(), black() and alpha() functions.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::getCmykF(float *c, float *m, float *y, float *k, float *a = nullptr) const
db:section.db:para: Sets the contents pointed to by c, m, y, k, and a, to the cyan, magenta, yellow, black, and alpha-channel (transparency) components of the color's CMYK value.
These components can be retrieved individually using the cyanF(), magentaF(), yellowF(), blackF() and alphaF() functions.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::getHsl(int *h, int *s, int *l, int *a = nullptr) const
db:section.db:para: Sets the contents pointed to by h, s, l, and a, to the hue, saturation, lightness, and alpha-channel (transparency) components of the color's HSL value.
These components can be retrieved individually using the hslHue(), hslSaturation(), lightness() and alpha() functions.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::getHslF(float *h, float *s, float *l, float *a = nullptr) const
db:section.db:para: Sets the contents pointed to by h, s, l, and a, to the hue, saturation, lightness, and alpha-channel (transparency) components of the color's HSL value.
These components can be retrieved individually using the hslHueF(), hslSaturationF(), lightnessF() and alphaF() functions.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::getHsv(int *h, int *s, int *v, int *a = nullptr) const
db:section.db:para: Sets the contents pointed to by h, s, v, and a, to the hue, saturation, value, and alpha-channel (transparency) components of the color's HSV value.
These components can be retrieved individually using the hue(), saturation(), value() and alpha() functions.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::getHsvF(float *h, float *s, float *v, float *a = nullptr) const
db:section.db:para: Sets the contents pointed to by h, s, v, and a, to the hue, saturation, value, and alpha-channel (transparency) components of the color's HSV value.
These components can be retrieved individually using the hueF(), saturationF(), valueF() and alphaF() functions.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::getRgb(int *r, int *g, int *b, int *a = nullptr) const
db:section.db:para: Sets the contents pointed to by r, g, b, and a, to the red, green, blue, and alpha-channel (transparency) components of the color's RGB value.
These components can be retrieved individually using the red(), green(), blue() and alpha() functions.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::getRgbF(float *r, float *g, float *b, float *a = nullptr) const
db:section.db:para: Sets the contents pointed to by r, g, b, and a, to the red, green, blue, and alpha-channel (transparency) components of the color's RGB value.
These components can be retrieved individually using the redF(), greenF(), blueF() and alphaF() functions.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QColor::green() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the green color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] float QColor::greenF() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the green color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QColor::hslHue() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the HSL hue color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] float QColor::hslHueF() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the HSL hue color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QColor::hslSaturation() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the HSL saturation color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] float QColor::hslSaturationF() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the HSL saturation color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QColor::hsvHue() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the HSV hue color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] float QColor::hsvHueF() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the hue color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QColor::hsvSaturation() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the HSV saturation color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] float QColor::hsvSaturationF() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the HSV saturation color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QColor::hue() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the HSV hue color component of this color.
The color is implicitly converted to HSV.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] float QColor::hueF() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the HSV hue color component of this color.
The color is implicitly converted to HSV.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QColor::isValid() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the color is valid; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 6.4] bool QColor::isValidColorName(QAnyStringView name)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the name is a valid color name and can be used to construct a valid QColor object, otherwise returns false.
It uses the same algorithm used in fromString().
This function was introduced in Qt 6.4.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QColor QColor::lighter(int factor = 150) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a lighter (or darker) color, but does not change this object.

If the factor is greater than 100, this functions returns a lighter color. Setting factor to 150 returns a color that is 50% brighter. If the factor is less than 100, the return color is darker, but we recommend using the darker() function for this purpose. If the factor is 0 or negative, the return value is unspecified.
The function converts the current color to HSV, multiplies the value (V) component by factor and converts the color back to it's original color spec.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QColor::lightness() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the lightness color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] float QColor::lightnessF() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the lightness color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QColor::magenta() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the magenta color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] float QColor::magentaF() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the magenta color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: QString QColor::name(QColor::NameFormat format = HexRgb) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the name of the color in the specified format.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QColor::red() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the red color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] float QColor::redF() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the red color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QRgb QColor::rgb() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the RGB value of the color. The alpha value is opaque.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QRgba64 QColor::rgba64() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the RGB64 value of the color, including its alpha.
For an invalid color, the alpha value of the returned color is unspecified.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QRgb QColor::rgba() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the RGB value of the color, including its alpha.
For an invalid color, the alpha value of the returned color is unspecified.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QColor::saturation() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the HSV saturation color component of this color.
The color is implicitly converted to HSV.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] float QColor::saturationF() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the HSV saturation color component of this color.
The color is implicitly converted to HSV.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::setAlpha(int alpha)
db:section.db:para: Sets the alpha of this color to alpha. Integer alpha is specified in the range 0-255.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::setAlphaF(float alpha)
db:section.db:para: Sets the alpha of this color to alpha. float alpha is specified in the range 0.0-1.0.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::setBlue(int blue)
db:section.db:para: Sets the blue color component of this color to blue. Integer components are specified in the range 0-255.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::setBlueF(float blue)
db:section.db:para: Sets the blue color component of this color to blue. If blue lies outside the 0.0-1.0 range, the color model will be changed to ExtendedRgb.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::setCmyk(int c, int m, int y, int k, int a = 255)
db:section.db:para: Sets the color to CMYK values, c (cyan), m (magenta), y (yellow), k (black), and a (alpha-channel, i.e. transparency).
All the values must be in the range 0-255.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::setCmykF(float c, float m, float y, float k, float a = 1.0)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Sets the color to CMYK values, c (cyan), m (magenta), y (yellow), k (black), and a (alpha-channel, i.e. transparency).
All the values must be in the range 0.0-1.0.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::setGreen(int green)
db:section.db:para: Sets the green color component of this color to green. Integer components are specified in the range 0-255.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::setGreenF(float green)
db:section.db:para: Sets the green color component of this color to green. If green lies outside the 0.0-1.0 range, the color model will be changed to ExtendedRgb.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::setHsl(int h, int s, int l, int a = 255)
db:section.db:para: Sets a HSL color value; h is the hue, s is the saturation, l is the lightness and a is the alpha component of the HSL color.
The saturation, value and alpha-channel values must be in the range 0-255, and the hue value must be greater than -1.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::setHslF(float h, float s, float l, float a = 1.0)
db:section.db:para: Sets a HSL color lightness; h is the hue, s is the saturation, l is the lightness and a is the alpha component of the HSL color.
All the values must be in the range 0.0-1.0.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::setHsv(int h, int s, int v, int a = 255)
db:section.db:para: Sets a HSV color value; h is the hue, s is the saturation, v is the value and a is the alpha component of the HSV color.
The saturation, value and alpha-channel values must be in the range 0-255, and the hue value must be greater than -1.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::setHsvF(float h, float s, float v, float a = 1.0)
db:section.db:para: Sets a HSV color value; h is the hue, s is the saturation, v is the value and a is the alpha component of the HSV color.
All the values must be in the range 0.0-1.0.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::setRed(int red)
db:section.db:para: Sets the red color component of this color to red. Integer components are specified in the range 0-255.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::setRedF(float red)
db:section.db:para: Sets the red color component of this color to red. If red lies outside the 0.0-1.0 range, the color model will be changed to ExtendedRgb.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::setRgb(int r, int g, int b, int a = 255)
db:section.db:para: Sets the RGB value to r, g, b and the alpha value to a.
All the values must be in the range 0-255.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] void QColor::setRgb(QRgb rgb)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Sets the RGB value to rgb. The alpha value is set to opaque.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] void QColor::setRgba64(QRgba64 rgba)
db:section.db:para: Sets the RGB64 value to rgba, including its alpha.

db:section.db:title: void QColor::setRgbF(float r, float g, float b, float a = 1.0)
db:section.db:para: Sets the color channels of this color to r (red), g (green), b (blue) and a (alpha, transparency).
The alpha value must be in the range 0.0-1.0. If any of the other values are outside the range of 0.0-1.0 the color model will be set as ExtendedRgb.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] void QColor::setRgba(QRgb rgba)
db:section.db:para: Sets the RGB value to rgba, including its alpha.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QColor::Spec QColor::spec() const
db:section.db:para: Returns how the color was specified.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QColor QColor::toCmyk() const
db:section.db:para: Creates and returns a CMYK QColor based on this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QColor QColor::toExtendedRgb() const
db:section.db:para: Create and returns an extended RGB QColor based on this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QColor QColor::toHsl() const
db:section.db:para: Creates and returns an HSL QColor based on this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QColor QColor::toHsv() const
db:section.db:para: Creates and returns an HSV QColor based on this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QColor QColor::toRgb() const
db:section.db:para: Create and returns an RGB QColor based on this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QColor::value() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the value color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] float QColor::valueF() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the value color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QColor::yellow() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the yellow color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] float QColor::yellowF() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the yellow color component of this color.

db:section.db:title: QVariant QColor::operator QVariant() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the color as a QVariant

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QColor::operator!=(const QColor &color) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this color has different color specification or component values from color; otherwise returns false.
ExtendedRgb and Rgb specifications are considered matching in this context.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QColor &QColor::operator=(Qt::GlobalColor color)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Assigns a copy of color and returns a reference to this color.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QColor::operator==(const QColor &color) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this color has the same color specification and component values as color; otherwise returns false.
ExtendedRgb and Rgb specifications are considered matching in this context.

db:section.db:title: QRgb
db:section.db:para: An ARGB quadruplet on the format #AARRGGBB, equivalent to an unsigned int.
The type also holds a value for the alpha-channel. The default alpha channel is ff, i.e opaque. For more information, see the Alpha-Blended Drawing section.
Here are some examples of how QRgb values can be created:

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] int qAlpha(QRgb rgba)
db:section.db:para: Returns the alpha component of the ARGB quadruplet rgba.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] uint qAlpha(QRgba64 rgba64)
db:section.db:para: Returns the alpha component of rgba64 as an 8-bit value.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] int qBlue(QRgb rgb)
db:section.db:para: Returns the blue component of the ARGB quadruplet rgb.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] uint qBlue(QRgba64 rgba64)
db:section.db:para: Returns the blue component of rgba64 as an 8-bit value.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] int qGray(int r, int g, int b)
db:section.db:para: Returns a gray value (0 to 255) from the (r, g, b) triplet.
The gray value is calculated using the formula (r * 11 + g * 16 + b * 5)/32.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] int qGray(QRgb rgb)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns a gray value (0 to 255) from the given ARGB quadruplet rgb.
The gray value is calculated using the formula (R * 11 + G * 16 + B * 5)/32; the alpha-channel is ignored.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] int qGreen(QRgb rgb)
db:section.db:para: Returns the green component of the ARGB quadruplet rgb.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] uint qGreen(QRgba64 rgba64)
db:section.db:para: Returns the green component of rgba64 as an 8-bit value.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QRgb qPremultiply(QRgb rgb)
db:section.db:para: Converts an unpremultiplied ARGB quadruplet rgb into a premultiplied ARGB quadruplet.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QRgba64 qPremultiply(QRgba64 rgba64)
db:section.db:para: Converts an unpremultiplied QRgba64 quadruplet rgba64 into a premultiplied QRgba64 quadruplet.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] int qRed(QRgb rgb)
db:section.db:para: Returns the red component of the ARGB quadruplet rgb.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] uint qRed(QRgba64 rgba64)
db:section.db:para: Returns the red component of rgba64 as an 8-bit value.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QRgb qRgb(int r, int g, int b)
db:section.db:para: Returns the ARGB quadruplet (255, r, g, b).

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QRgba64 qRgba64(quint64 c)
db:section.db:para: Returns c as a QRgba64 struct.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QRgba64 qRgba64(quint16 r, quint16 g, quint16 b, quint16 a)
db:section.db:para: Returns the QRgba64 quadruplet (r, g, b, a).

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QRgb qRgba(int r, int g, int b, int a)
db:section.db:para: Returns the ARGB quadruplet (a, r, g, b).

db:section.db:title: QRgb qUnpremultiply(QRgb rgb)
db:section.db:para: Converts a premultiplied ARGB quadruplet rgb into an unpremultiplied ARGB quadruplet.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QRgba64 qUnpremultiply(QRgba64 rgba64)
db:section.db:para: Converts a premultiplied QRgba64 quadruplet rgba64 into an unpremultiplied QRgba64 quadruplet.

db:section.db:title: QDataStream &operator<<(QDataStream &stream, const QColor &color)
db:section.db:para: Writes the color to the stream.

db:section.db:title: QDataStream &operator>>(QDataStream &stream, QColor &color)
db:section.db:para: Reads the color from the stream.

db:section.db:title: Obsolete Members for QColor
db:section.db:para: The following members of class QColor are deprecated. We strongly advise against using them in new code.

db:section.db:title: [static, deprecated in 6.6] bool QColor::isValidColor(const QString &name)
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated since 6.6. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Use isValidColorName() instead.
Returns true if the name is a valid color name and can be used to construct a valid QColor object, otherwise returns false.
It uses the same algorithm used in setNamedColor().

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, deprecated in 6.6] bool QColor::isValidColor(QLatin1StringView name)
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated since 6.6. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
This is an overloaded function.
Use isValidColorName() instead.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, deprecated in 6.6] bool QColor::isValidColor(QStringView name)
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated since 6.6. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
This is an overloaded function.
Use isValidColorName() instead.

db:section.db:title: [deprecated in 6.6] void QColor::setNamedColor(const QString &name)
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated since 6.6. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Use fromString() instead.
Sets the RGB value of this QColor to name, which may be in one of these formats:

db:listitem.db:para: #RGB (each of R, G, and B is a single hex digit)

A name from the list of colors defined in the list of SVG color keyword names provided by the World Wide Web Consortium; for example, "steelblue" or "gainsboro". These color names work on all platforms. Note that these color names are not the same as defined by the Qt::GlobalColor enums, e.g. "green" and Qt::green does not refer to the same color.
transparent - representing the absence of a color.

db:section.db:para: The color is invalid if name cannot be parsed.

db:section.db:title: [deprecated in 6.6] void QColor::setNamedColor(QLatin1StringView name)
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated since 6.6. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
This is an overloaded function.
Use fromString() instead.

db:section.db:title: [deprecated in 6.6] void QColor::setNamedColor(QStringView name)
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated since 6.6. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
This is an overloaded function.
Use fromString() instead.
